title: Eurozone growth grinds to a halt as German economy shrinks - as it happened | Business | The Guardian
summary: eurozone grinds to a halt , with gdp flat in second quarter of 2014
portugal beats forecasts with 0.6 % rise in gdp .
yield on 10-year german debt hits record low below 1 %
netherlands economy expands by 0.5 % as growth returns .
france : we 'll miss our public deficit target .
german economy contracts ; gdp falls by 0.2 %
french economy stagnates - gdp unchanged in q2 2014

documents.title: greek tourism on the up
text: a quick ps from greece where , yet again , figures show that record numbers of tourists have helped pull the economy out of the doldrums .
our correspondent helena smith reports from athens : by all accounts it 's been a great week for figures in greece .

for the first time since 2008 - a year before the outbreak of its worst financial crisis in modern times - the economy has made its smallest contraction ever , shrinking by 0.2 percent in the first quarter , it 's slowest annual pace in six years and the best hope yet that the country may finally be emerging from its worst ever recession .

and for a country where trickle-down economics begins with tourism there is more good news : greece appears to have become the hottest tourist destination on the continent of europe with arrivals more than meeting target goals , according to the confederation of greek tourism enterprises ( sete ) .

despite a drop in tourists from russia and the ukraine , greece is well on track to hosting 19 million holiday-makers this year ( 21.5 million if visitors on cruise ships are taken into account ) , by far the highest record ever .
revenues are predicted to reach 13 billion euro or just over 17 percent of gross national output .
andreas andreadis , who heads sete , said arrivals from january to july had shot up by 16.5 percent , compared to the same period last year , a major incentive for growth .

leading airports showed double-digit increases with athens posting a 31 % rise and kalamata and mykonos ( new landing grounds for ryan air and easy jet ) showing increases of 39.9 % and 62.5 percent respectively .
markets have largely recovered from this morning 's dip .
ftse 100 up 0.45 % , or 30 points at 6687 germany dax up 0.4 % france cac up 0.3 % italy ftse mib up 0.3 % spain ibex down 0.1 % and with that we 'll close the blog for the day .
thanks for all your comments .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning .
a handy map to guide you through the gdp data out today , courtesy of the guardian 's graphics team .
eurozone gdp ground to a halt , as the german economy shrank in the second quarter .
( jo moulds taking over from graeme briefly )

documents.title: eurozone stumbles : a summary
text: europe 's faltering recovery has taken a blow after growth in the region ground to a halt in the last quarter .
eurozone gdp was flat in the april-june quarter , compared to january-march , as its three largest members all struggled .
eurozone gdp , q2 2014 photograph : /eurostat germany suffered an unexpected 0.2 % contraction , matching italy which fell back into recession .
france 's gdp was unchanged for the second quarter running , dashing hopes of a modest return to growth .
[ round-up here ] there was better news in the 'periphery ' , with portugal and spain both growing by 0.6 % in q2 .
the netherlands grew by 0.5 % , and there are also hopes that greece 's downturn is over .

yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) rt @ twitterid # greece was 2nd fastest growing €zone economy in q2 after latvia acc to unofficial data : /via @ twitterid # euro our news story is here : eurozone growth splutters to a halt as crisis enters new phase full rolling coverage starts here .
and here 's larry elliott 's analysis : eurozone can learn from george osborne and bank of england stimulus fears are growing that the euro area risks sinking into a new recession .
chris williamson , economist at markit , says : a stalling of economic growth in the second quarter raises concerns that the euro area is sliding back into a triple dip recession .
many , including the european central bank , point to survey data suggesting such fears are overplayed , and that growth will revive as previously announced stimulus take effect .
but the weakness of economic growth will certainly fuel louder calls for the ecb to do more to reinvigorate growth across the single currency area . ''
could the eurozone be dragged deeper into a lost decade ?

kit juckes , currency strategist at societe generale , sums up the problems : too little growth to stop the debt snowball , a vicious cycle of fiscal austerity and lack of aggregate demand staying in place and dooming europe to japanification .
nancy curtin , chief investment officer at close brothers asset management , agrees pressure is mounting on ecb chief mario draghi : draghi is involved in a game of brinkmanship .
it is not fiscal austerity but evidence of structural reform that he is looking for before he considers sanctioning european style qe , especially from italy and france .
however , structural reforms do not happen overnight , and as the case for qe strengthens , any delay will have a disproportionate impact on the pace of recovery in the rest of europe .
the weak data forced france to admit that it wo n't hit its goal of lowering its deficit to 3.8 % of gdp this year .

finance minister michel sapin halved its growth forecast in 2014 to 0.5 % , from 1 % , and pleaded for leniency : european policies must be refocused by adapting the pace of deficit reduction to the current economic environment '' .
and even more money has flooded into german and french government debt , driving down the yield on 10-year german bunds below 1 % for the first time ever .
that shows investors are bracing for weak growth , and perhaps a qe programme .

documents.title: what the readers say
text: thank you for the many excellent comments this morning .

here 's a selection : beckyp 14 august 2014 7:28am this comment has been chosen by guardian staff because it contributes to the debate an obsession on gdp , rather than gdp per capita , is missing the point with gdp per capita gives a more accurate assessment of the dynamics of economic growth/decline .
sadly , within the uk , the obsession with gdp is akin to smoking mirrors a deceitful approach in the run up to the next general election .

shiresofengland 14 august 2014 7:37am this comment has been chosen by guardian staff because it contributes to the debate stagnation , high unemployment in some ez countries , huge youth unemployment in some , high debt to gdp ratios , no chance of some ever getting to the 3 % debt to gdp ration for deficits ( france ) just as it has been for years , and there is little or no chance of ever reaching escape velocity .
the eurozone will always be unworkable because the euro is unworkable .
same old , same old , and will continue for years unless someone has the bravery to break the cycle .

unprogressive 14 august 2014 8:15am this comment has been chosen by guardian staff because it contributes to the debate for the ez it is not `` growth '' that is the problem , it is the very low inflation.these growth figures take into account inflation - and it is possible for an economy to have negative absolute growth but still have positive `` real '' growth.the problem is the debt dynamics - the total amount of outstanding government debt does not decrease because of deflation , neither does it increase because of inflation ( there may be changes to yields , but i 'm trying to keep it simple ) .the uk has gone some way to stabilising its debt/gdp ratio , not through cuts ( in absolute terms government has never spent so much money ) but by using inflation.this has punished savers ( creditors ) and given debtors a chance to sort themselves out.imo the ez as a whole needs some inflation .

risclives 14 august 2014 9:56am this comment has been chosen by guardian staff because it contributes to the debate there are dire imbalances in the eurozone : some countries have huge deficits while germany has a huge ( trade ) surplus .
countries who have had deficits for too long must correct their deficits , but that must be balanced by a german policy of eroding its surplus , which is also an « imbalance » .

the great error of the eurozone is that germany demands immediate deficit correction from the piigs ( to which i fully agree ) but refuses toa ccept the most obvious side-effect of its trade partners correcting their deficits , which is that german surplus must mirror this trend .
by clinging to maintain its surplus unhindered while imposing tight money policies on the eurozone and deficit corrections on its trade partners , germany is in fact man-making a recession .
babyboomer55 14 august 2014 11:05am draghi is involved in a game of brinkmanship .

it is not fiscal austerity but evidence of structural reform that he is looking for before he considers sanctioning european style qe , he 's got a long wait then ; - ) lovecatsanddogs2 14 august 2014 12:15pm the gdp figures might show gdp , but they do not show the budget dificits with it .
so the uk is running a budget deficit of about 5.5 % whereas germany is running a budget surplus , i.e .
it collect more in taxes than it spends and for the first time since ww2 its total debt is falling , where as in the uk total debt is growing very quickly .

documents.title: market update
text: back in the stock markets , and europe 's leading indices have recovered their early falls , despite the grim gdp data .
the ftse 100 , german dax and french cac are all up around 0.5 % .
the rally comes as russian president vladimir putin pledged that russia would do everything in our power '' to stop the bloodshed in ukraine .
russian market ( @ russian market ) on this daily chart of german market dax you can exactly see when putin started his speech on ukraine
as flagged up earlier , the eurozone suffered a double-dose of bad news this morning - with inflation hitting just 0.4 % , its lowest level since 2009 .
nicholas spiro ( @ nicholasspiro ) the ecb has allowed the eurozone to sleepwalk into deflation .
my interview to cnbc :
as this graph shows , europe 's economy faltered three years ago as the debt crisis exploded .

it recovered after that crisis eased , but hopes of a sustained bounce-back have faltered : paul drees ( @ marketedgepd ) euro area ( ea14 ) real gdp flat ; germany , italy -0.2 % ; france flat ; ea14 lags us and uk # marketedge # eurozone # gdp

there is more chance of germany suffering a recession this year than adding the european championship trophy to the world cup it secured last month in brazil : here 's paddy power 's latest odds : will germany have two consecutive quarters of negative growth in 2014 ?
7/4 yes 2/5 no will the eurozone area have two consecutive quarters of negative growth in 2014 ?
5/6 yes 5/6 no germany to win euro 2016 3/1

documents.title: larry elliott : eurozone can learn from george osborne and bank of england stimulus
text: here 's a phrase you do n't read every day on the guardian give george osborne some credit . ''
why , exactly ?
because the chancellor had enough gumption to abandon his goal of eliminating britain 's budget deficit in this parliament , once it became abundantly clear that the plan was off course .
as larry elliott , our economics editor , argues , europe should take note : want to understand what 's happening in the eurozone ?
then think back a couple of years to the early years of the uk 's coalition government .
that was the time when the british economy was flatlining .
sure , there were periods when activity expanded .
but the recovery never really gained traction and was vulnerable to unexpected shocks .
sometimes these were external - as with the eurozone 's debt crisis ; sometimes they were internal - as with ill-timed and excessive austerity .
the upshot was that the recovery never really got going until the bank of england stepped in with its funding for lending scheme and put some oomph back into the housing market .
now take a look at the eurozone .
here too , the economy is struggling to gain traction .
here too , it is extremely sensitive to shocks , the latest of which is the threat of a full-scale confrontation between russia and ukraine .
here too , there has been far too much austerity far too soon to read on , click here : eurozone can learn from george osborne and bank of england stimulus
bloomberg tv ( @ bloombergtv ) lots of european gdp figures out this morning .
here 's a handy round-up :
today 's weak data has not hurt the euro .
it 's hovering around $ 1.337 against the us dollar , and 80.1p against the pound .
but jonathan wilks , head of foreign exchange dealing at investec corporate and institutional treasury , reckons the single currency could weaken , hurting british firms who export to the eurozone .

he says : the euro may not have moved immediately in response to the disappointing economic data from france and germany but if speculation about further central bank stimulus is correct , it would n't be a surprise to see a longer term weakening trend for the currency .

as the economies of the uk and continental europe increasingly uncouple , the opposite is likely for sterling when interest rates finally increase , creating a headache for anyone exporting to the european market .
profits are already being eroded by the strength of the pound , with many companies already having to restate their forecasts .
given the dynamics in play at the moment it would be unwise to bet against more of the same in the next reporting season . ''

documents.title: read the news story here
text: here 's larry elliott 's news story on today 's disappointing gdp figures : eurozone growth splutters to a halt as crisis enters new phase it includes this warning , from chris williamson , economist at markit : a stalling of economic growth in the second quarter raises concerns that the euro area is sliding back into a triple dip recession .
many , including the european central bank , point to survey data suggesting such fears are overplayed , and that growth will revive as previously announced stimulus take effect .
but the weakness of economic growth will certainly fuel louder calls for the ecb to do more to reinvigorate growth across the single currency area . ''
quarter-on-quarter growth data can be erratic , so we should also look at the year-on-year figures for a broader view .
and alberto nardelli , our incoming data editor , has even colour-coded the latest data ( green = growth ; purple/pink = contraction ) .
alberto nardelli ( @ albertonardelli ) eu gdp , y/y , by country
rbs economic insight ( @ rbs economics ) 0 out of 3.not one of the eurozone 's 3 largest economies managed to grow in q2.spain , the 4th largest , bucked the trend

documents.title: european gdp in full
text: here 's a round-up of all the latest growth/contraction figures for the eu ( i 've excluded countries who have n't reported gdp for the second quarter yet ) .

belgium : +0.1 % quarter-on-quarter bulgaria : +0.5 % czech republic : 0.0 germany : -0.2 % estonia : +0.5 % spain : + 0.6 % france : 0.0 % italy : -0.2 % cyprus : -0.3 % latvia : +1.0 % lithuania : +0.7 % hungary : +0.8 % netherlands : +0.5 austria : +0.2 % poland : +0.6 % portugal : +0.6 % romania : -1.0 % slovakia : +0.6 % finland : +0.1 % sweden : +0.2 % united kingdom : +0.8 % which all adds up to zero growth in the eurozone , and 0.2 % growth in the eu .

documents.title: nancy curtin : pressure mounting on mario draghi
text: two years after calming the eurozone crisis by pledging to do whatever it takes '' to preserve the euro , ecb chief mario draghi is under pressure again to revive growth and fend off deflation .
nancy curtin , chief investment officer at close brothers asset management .
says all eyes are on draghi to take further action to boost liquidity '' even europe 's biggest economies are showing signs of trouble , which is dragging on corporate earnings .

italy has fallen back into recession , while more forward looking data points to an ongoing slowdown in both france and germany , triggering the euro to hit an 11 month low draghi is involved in a game of brinkmanship .
it is not fiscal austerity but evidence of structural reform that he is looking for before he considers sanctioning european style qe , especially from italy and france .
however , structural reforms do not happen overnight , and as the case for qe strengthens , any delay will have a disproportionate impact on the pace of recovery in the rest of europe .
the pressure on draghi is mounting .

documents.title: analyst : germany could soften opposition to qe
text: the euro zone is staring recession in the face once more , '' warns ben brettell , senior economist , hargreaves lansdown , after seeing that growth stuttered to a halt last quarter .

he also believes that the weakness in germany 's economy could melt the country 's opposition to quantitative easing in the eurozone ( - creating new money to buy government bonds and hopefully stimulate growth ) brettell says : this exceptionally weak data increases the pressure on mario draghi to make good his pledge to do whatever it takes '' and finally embark on a quantitative easing programme .
indeed the french finance minister has released a statement urging the ecb chief to act .

ideally draghi would have liked breathing space to see if the measures introduced in june have the desired effect , but in truth today 's dreadful data calls for urgent action to prevent the euro zone slipping into a japan-style cycle of stagnation and deflation .
the most severe problems in the euro zone have so far been limited to the periphery , with the core remaining in relative good health , but the last few months have seen something of a shift .
some peripheral economies are now registering decent gdp growth ( portugal beat forecasts with 0.6 % in q2 and spain is growing at the same rate ) , whilst the core looks in increasing trouble .

germany has always been a notable opponent to quantitative easing - bundesbank chief jens weidmann said this week that the responsibility for stimulating growth lies with individual member states rather than the ecb - but perhaps today 's shock gdp contraction will lead to a softening in this stance .
cyprus remains in recession , but the pace of the downturn in the austerity-gripped country has eased .
cyprus 's gdp fell by another 0.3 % in q2 , compared with a 0.6 % fall in january-march .
its economy has shrunk by 2.5 % over the last year .
we also have confirmation that the eurozone slipped closer to deflation last month .
the euro area consumer prices index rose by just 0.4 % in july , the lowest rate since october 2009 .
prices are falling in five eu countries - bulgaria , greece , portugal , spain and slovakia , and were flat in italy , estonia and poland .
while the eurozone stagnated , the wider european union grew by 0.2 % in april-june .
that 's partly thanks to the uk , which recorded a 0.8 % rise in gdp .
eurostat 's report is here .
it includes this chart , showing how the us economy outpaced europe in q2 , with growth of around 1 % .
gavin hewitt ( @ bbcgavinhewitt ) growth in the eurozone has fallen to zero in the second quarter .
the much touted recovery has stalled .

documents.title: eurozone grinds to a halt , with gdp flat in second quarter of 2014
text: breaking : the eurozone economy stagnated in the second quarter of the year , confirming fears over the strength of the recovery .
eurostat reports that gdp across the euro area was flat in the april-june quarter , as growth ground to a halt .
the economy was dragged back by the shock contraction in germany , where the economy shrank by 0.2 % .
the ongoing malaise in france , which has stagnated since the start of the year , is also holding back the recovery .
as we have tracked for the last few hours , this morning 's growth data has painted a rather dire for the euro area .
portugal and the netherlands , along with spain last week , were rare highlights .
ok , it 's nearly time to find out how the overall eurozone economy performed in the second quarter of 2014 .
economists had predicted that gdp would only rise by 0.1 % .
but that was before we learned that germany had contracted by 0.2 % , and that france was still stagnating
portugal 's ine statistics body says an increase in exports of goods and services '' helped the country post 0.6 % growth last quarter .
on an annual basis , gdp is up by 0.8 % - pulled back by the contraction in the first quarter .

documents.title: portugal beats forecasts with 0.6 % rise in gdp
text: there will be sighs of relief in lisbon , as portugal 's economy returns to growth after a bad start to the year .
portuguese gdp rose by 0.6 % in april-june , beating forecasts of 0.5 % .
that follows the 0.6 % contraction in january-march .
this means portugal has joined spain and slovakia as the fastest-growing countries in the euro area ( i think ) .
berenberg economics ( @ berenberg econ ) # portugal gdp grew by 0.6 % qoq in q2 , but after very weak q1 .
pt tops eurozone growth table in q2 with spain .
italy and germany trail .
michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) portugal q2 gdp comes in at 0.6 % exp : 0.5 %

kit juckes , currency strategist at societe generale , sums up the problem in europe : too little growth to stop the debt snowball , a vicious cycle of fiscal austerity and lack of aggregate demand staying in place and dooming europe to japanification .
a rise in exports helped bulgaria to grow by 0.5 % during the last quarter .
on an annual basis , gdp rose by 1.6 % .
michael mcdonough ( @ m mcdonough ) german 10y yield drops below 1 % for first time :
oliver cooper ( @ olivercooper ) gdp growth in last three months ( annualised ) : germany -0.8 % , italy -0.8 % , france 0 % , united kingdom +3.2 % .

documents.title: yield on 10-year german debt hits record low below 1 %
text: the surge of money into german government bonds has driven the interest rate , or yield , on 10-year bunds below the 1 % mark for the first time ever .
french government has also rallied in value , pushing down the yield on its 10-year debt to just 1.392 % .

steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) germany 's 10-year yield drops below 1 % for first time on record such low yields are a sign that investors expect weak growth , and low inflation , in the euro area for a while .
decent growth figures from poland - its economy grew by 3.2 % over the last year .
glenn tyrpa ( @ glenntyrpa ) poland 's q2 gdp grows by 3.2 % y/y to meet expectations ; q1 growth confirmed at 3.4 % y/y - stats office flash estimate
the winners and losers so far : markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) @ markiteconomics here 's the chart with the correct headline :
slovakia 's economy expanded by 0.6 % during the last quarter .
that matches spain 's growth rate during the quarter ( spanish gdp was released a couple of weeks ago ) .
france 's declaration today that it will miss its deficit targets is n't a surprise , but is an important moment .
so says city analyst marc ostwald of adm investor services .
marc ostwald ( @ mostwald1 ) # francegdp : abandoning deficit targets a declaration of political bankruptcy ; likely to play a major role in reviving the eurozone crisis
katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) barclays : `` france q2 gdp : yet another disappointment - towards entrenched stagnation ? ''

documents.title: netherlands economy expands by 0.5 % as growth returns
text: the netherlands has returned to growth , in a much-needed boost for the eurozone after a bruising morning .
the dutch economy grew by 0.5 % in the april-june quarter , its statistics office reports .

and the contraction in the first three months of the year has also been revised up , to a 0.4 % drop in gdp from 0.6 % initially ( partly due to a drop in energy use during the mild winter ) jeroen blokland ( @ jsblokland ) eureka !
dutch # gdp grows 0.5 % in q2 , q1 revised upwards to -0.4 % ( was -0.6 % ) .
interesting point : minefornothing ( @ minefornothing ) the only reason french gdp did n't fall in q2 was because household energy consumption rose 3.5 % in q2 due to a warmer than normal q1

documents.title: european stock markets fall after weak gdp
text: investors in paris and frankfurt are not impressed by today 's data .
france 's cac 40 index of leading shares has fallen by 0.35 % , or 14 points , in early trading to 4180 .
the german dax lost 26 points , or 0.3 % , to 9172 .

documents.title: austria grows by 0.2 %
text: austria has outpaced germany .
austrian gdp rose by 0.2 % in the april-june quarter .
not a great performance , but better than many neighbours .
berenberg economics ( @ berenberg econ ) # austria : gdp up 0.2 % qoq in q2 .
better than expected given the country 's eastern exposure .
wolfgang munchau of eurointelligence says today 's figures from germany and france are absolutely awful '' - putting the eurozone once again on the brink of recession '' .
ferdinand fichtner , economist at germany 's diw thinktank , says : ( via reuters ) : the german economy may have slipped into a slight recession due to crises . ''
to be an official recession , german gdp would also have to fall during the current quarter .
the escalating tensions between the west and moscow ( which has banned many food imports ) makes that more likely .
bad news from romania , though .
it 's annual growth rate has more than halved in the last three months , to +1.2 % from 3.4 % in q1 .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) so spectacularly bad romania gdp and that 's even before russia 's counter-sanctions have started to kick in .
finally some good news , from hungary .
its economy grew by 3.9 % over the last 12 months , up from 3.5 % in the first quarter of 2014 .
that 's the fastest annual rate since 2006 .
( quarter-on-quarter data is n't available ) .
yiannis mouzakis ( @ yiannismouzakis ) but they said # euro zone was fixed

sovereign bond expert nick spiro is alarmed by the state of the eurozone economy right now : nicholas spiro ( @ nicholasspiro ) two-thirds of eurozone gdp is now either in recesssion , flirting with it or contracted in the second quarter .
recovery ?
what recovery ?
lots more growth data to come this morning , from smaller countries across the european union .
the wall street journal has helpfully rounded up the details 08:00 slovakia , austria , czech republic , hungary , romania 08:30 netherlands 09:00 poland , bulgaria 09:30 portugal 10:00 euro zone

documents.title: france urges the ecb to do more
text: as well as halving france 's growth forecast in 2014 to just 0.5 % , finance minister michel sapin also urged the european central bank to use all available means to fight deflation and bring euro to more competitive level '' , in his op-ed piece in le monde today .
the ecb has already promised to flood the euro banking sector with another €400bn in cheap liquidity , to encourage small business lending .

but critics are certain to seize on today 's disappointing growth in germany and france as proof that it must go further , and embrace full-blown quantitative easing ( buying government bonds and securities with new money ) .
ecb chief mario draghi has said qe is an option .
but he 's also repeatedly urged eurozone leaders to crack on with economic reforms to stimulate growth .
not an area where france has excelled .
it 's been a double-whammy of bad eurozone news so far , says analysts at french bnp paribas : katie martin ( @ katie martin fx ) bnp : `` french and german gdp : double-ouch ''

documents.title: some early reaction to the gdp data
text: squawk box europe ( @ squawkboxeurope ) not just the periphery !
germany 's economy unexpectedly contracts in q2 - -0.2 % q/q - trade and investment weigh .
gavin hewitt ( @ bbcgavinhewitt ) in the second q of the year the french econ was stagnant , reporting zero growth .
french min says growth target of 1 % now impossible. # france gavin hewitt ( @ bbcgavinhewitt ) germany 's economy contracted by 0.2 % in the q2 .
imports grew faster than exports .
watch for growth figures later and the 'ukraine ' effect .
george markides ( @ georgiemark ) germany contracts by 0.2 % , about time too as long as the eurozone sputters germany sputters and no fiscal compass/six pack can fix that .

we learned last week that italy , europe 's third largest economy , has fallen back into recession with gdp dropping by 0.2 % during the second quarter with germany also shrinking , and france stagnating , there are worries that the wider eurozone growth figure ( 10am bst ) could be a disappointment too .
juergen baetz ( @ jbaetz ) germany , italy , france - the q2 growth figures do n't bode well for the # eurozone - data coming at 11 cet , wo n't be pretty , alas .
the interest rate , or yield , on german debt has hit a new record low this morning after this morning 's disappointing ( no ) growth figures .
the yield on 10-year bunds slumped to just 1.022 % - the lowest rate of return on record .

documents.title: ing : germany is still the eurozone growth engine
text: carsten brzeski , economist at ing , blames germany 's shrinking economy on its domestic market and its eurozone neighbours , rather than geopolitics .
he says : contrary to a common belief , the stagnation is not so much the result of crisis in the ukraine and european sanctions on russia but it 's rather homemade .
or better : homemade and eurozone-made .

the reversal of the mild-weather-effect on the construction sector , an unusual amount of holidays in may combined with ongoing problems in france and italy should have been the main drivers of the slowdown of the german economy .

he does n't believe germany is losing its position as the euro powerhouse , though : as long as the second and third largest eurozone economies ( france and italy ) are struggling to accelerate their reform pace , the german economy will remain the eurozone 's main growth engine .
more here : the end of the wirtschaftswunder ?
a reminder of how germany 's economy had performed over the last two years .
tv
germany 's federal statistics office says the 0.2 % contraction is mainly due to a disappointing performance on foreign trade and investment .
especially in the construction sector ( which may be slowing down after benefitting from a mild winter ) .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) according to @ twitterid foreign trade and capital formation had a negative impact on german # gdp
the shock contraction in germany is certain to fuel concerns that europe 's recovery is coming off the rails .
is germany finally feeling the impact of the wider problems in the eurozone , having outperformed its neighbours last year ?

the really worrying thing is that this data covers april-june , before recent sanctions against russia - a major trade partner for germany - would have bitten ( a survey on tuesday showed that economic confidence in germany tumbled in july as the ukraine crisis escalated ) arjun kharpal ( @ arjunkharpal ) europe 's 'powerhouse ' # germany sees q2 gdp down 0.2 % from previous quarter , after france reports no growth brenda kelly ( @ brendakelly ig ) the 'powerhouse ' of europe .

documents.title: german economy contracts ; gdp falls by 0.2 %
text: breaking : the german economy has contracted , in a serious blow to the eurozone economy .
german gdp fell by 0.2 % in the last quarter , the first drop since 2012 .
that 's worse than expected - many economists had predicted that germany would have stagnated .
and in another hit , growth in the first quarter of 2014 has also been revised down , from 0.8 % to 0.7 % .
details to follow

documents.title: france : we 'll miss our public deficit target
text: it 's official - france expects to miss its growth targets , and its deficit targets , this year .
france 's finance minister michel sapin made the admission in an opinion piece in the le monde newspaper this morning .

he writes : the truth is that , as a direct consequence of sluggish growth and insufficient inflation , france will not meet its public deficit target this year despite a complete control of spending , '' sapin , of course , would already have known that france 's economy had not expanded in the last quarter .
on bloomberg tv , ubs currency strategist beat siegenthaler says he 's not surprised that the french economy has failed to grow again , given its well-documented weakness .
he 's more concerned about how germany performed , given its close links to russia .
we get the german gdp figure in a few minutes

documents.title: french gdp , the details .
text: so why has france stagnated again ?
today 's gdp report shows that companies slashed their investment again , with gross fixed capital formation '' shrinking by 1.1 % between april and june .
french companies also struggled , with exports unchanged .
imports also fell back to +0.4 % , from 0.6 % in q1 .
consequently , the foreign trade balance contributed negatively to activity , '' insee says .
household consumption did increase , though , by 0.5 % .
the full report is here .

documents.title: french economy stagnates - gdp unchanged in q2 2014
text: breaking news : france 's economy failed to expand in the last quarter .
insee , the statistics body , has reported that french gdp was unchanged in the three months between april and june .
that 's a nasty shock - economists had expected a small expansion .
it 's the second quarter of stagnation in a row - as europe 's second largest economy struggles to grow .
it 's a bad start to eurozone gdp day - with germany 's gdp reading due in under 20 minutes

documents.title: eurozone gdp figures to dominate the day
text: good morning .
we 're about to find out how well the eurozone economy performed in the last quarter , and it may not be pretty .
today 's the day when the first estimates of gdp across the single currency for april-june are released .
results day for eurozone politicians and policymakers , perhaps .
and the results could be rather unimpressive , reigniting fears over the health of the euro area .
economists believe that germany , the powerhouse of the region , has faltered after a strong start to 2014 .
it could even have contracted .
and france is unlikely to have dragged itself out of its economic malaise - with growth of just 0.1 % expected .
the overall eurozone may also have grown by as little as 0.1 % too , following the rather limp 0.2 % expansion in the first quarter .
not enough to propel europe forwards .
as claus vistesen , chief euro zone economist at pantheon macroeconomics , put it to cnbc : growth in the euro area is perilously low , and vulnerable to even slight setbacks in sentiment .
at the current rate , growth is far too low and uncertain to make a meaningful difference to a still high unemployment rate and too high debt levels . ''
we get france 's gdp figure first , followed by germany at 7am bst .
then a flood of other countries at regular intervals until 10am , when the overall eurozone growth figure is released .
i 'll be tracking all the details , reaction and analysis , though the morning .

bulletin.text: Eurozone recovery takes a knock, as Germany suffers a shock contraction in the last quarter and France stagnates.
Eurozone economy fails to grow in Q2
German GDP falls by 0.2% in second quarter of 2014
French finance minister: We'll miss our deficit target.
Introduction: Results Day for eurozone leaders.
